intro: Ranunculus degenii f. emianus, commonly known as the Emianus buttercup, is a rare and distinctive flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often colorful flowers. The plant features delicate, palmate leaves and produces bright yellow or white flowers with numerous stamens. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is typically found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
